sa7:1.2: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park in Jeta’s Grove of Śrāvastī.
sa7:2.1: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks,
sa7:2.2: “When you delight in form, you delight in suffering.
sa7:2.3: Delighting in suffering, it’s not possible to be liberated from suffering.
sa7:2.4: Thus, when you delight in feeling … perception … volition … consciousness, you delight in suffering.
sa7:2.5: Delighting in suffering, it’s not possible to be liberated from suffering.
sa7:3.1: “Monks, when you don’t delight in form, you don’t delight in suffering.
sa7:3.2: Not delighting in suffering, it’s possible to be liberated from suffering.
sa7:3.3: Thus, when you don’t delight in feeling … perception … volition … consciousness, you don’t delight in suffering.
sa7:3.4: Not delighting in suffering, it’s possible to be liberated from suffering.”
sa7:4.1: When the monks who heard what the Buddha taught, they rejoiced and approved.
